POST-DOCTORAL RESEARCH

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”full_width” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern” z_index=””][vc_column css=”.vc_custom_1575835851507{padding-left: 0px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1580395145314{background-color: #ffffff !important;}” el_class=”content-section curved-bottom-right space16″]

In the context of enhancing its research status, UNIWA encourages and enables young scientists to conduct postdoctoral research in subjects that fall under the re-search interests and topics of its academic staff and corresponding laboratories profiles.

The main objectives of postdoctoral research at UNIWA are the following:

  • Supporting young scientists capable of contributing to the advancement of science, research and its applications, especially in cutting-edge fields, and to promote UNIWA as a University that supports the Young Scientists.
  • Expanding the doctoral results to new scientific directions of interest in alignment with the University’s research targets.
  • Upgrading the quality of scientific research and disseminating the results and transfer of know-how practices.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
